glosses: to be jealous of something or someone, envy

examples.translation: My son is jealous of his brother/sister.

etymology:
From Ottoman Turkish قیصقانمق (kıskanmak), قزقانمق (kızkanmak, “to be jealous or envious”), derived from Proto-Turkic *Kɨŕ (“expensive, miserly”). Compare Karakhanid [script needed] (kız, “rare, expensive”).
Cognate with Old Turkic [script needed] (kızɣan-, “to grudge, be unwilling to give”), Azerbaijani qısqanmaq (“to be jealous”), Chuvash хӗрхенме (hĕrh̬enme, “to grudge, begrudge”), Kyrgyz кызгануу (kızganuu, “to be jealous”), Uzbek qizgʻanmoq (“to be jealous”).
